title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@rstudio.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to MAMU
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to MAMU
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("popovs/MAMU", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to MAMU
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

what: Download British Columbia Digital Elevation Model data
title: BC_DEM
text: province British Columbia two digital elevation model (DEM) datasets available website download. 25m resolution gridded Canadian Digital Elevation Data (CDED) format DEM free, ’s fairly complicated get user-friendly data - user must first determine DEM map tile wish download, download strip tile zipped file, unzip strips, stitch strip together single usable DEM raster file. BC_DEM() function automates entire process . Simply specify map tile wish download function take care everything else .

previous_headings: Download British Columbia Digital Elevation Model data
title: BC_DEM
text: map tiles available download correspond BC Maps & Orthos tiles. moment, BC_DEM supports downloading one map tile time.
code: library(MAMU)  # Download Vancouver-area DEM dem <- BC_DEM("92g",               save_output = FALSE) #> Stitching together your DEM...  terra::plot(dem)

what: Download British Columbia Digital Elevation Model data — BC_DEM
title: Download British Columbia Digital Elevation Model data — BC_DEM
text: Download BC DEM data gridded Canadian Digital Elevation Data (CDED) format. WARNING: function still unstable, cause R Session abort download large number tiles. despair! download many tiles R Session aborts attempting stitch rasters together, downloaded unzipped .dem files somewhere machine - R just ran memory actually trying stitch together. open new R Session enter tempdir() console, raster data somewhere vicinity, one Rtmp*/DEM_ZIP/DEM directories computer. need go time consuming step re-downloading rasters.

title: Download British Columbia Digital Elevation Model data — BC_DEM
code: BC_DEM(   letterblock,   save_output = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   output_dir = NA,   filename = NA )

title: Download British Columbia Digital Elevation Model data — BC_DEM
text: letterblock Map tiles DEM data download, e.g. '92b'. See BC Maps & Orthos Base Map Online Store visual: https://a100.gov.bc.ca/ext/mtec/public/products/mapsheet save_output Logical (T/F). downloaded DEM saved local disk? Default TRUE. overwrite Logical (T/F). downloaded DEM overwrite existing BC DEM data disk, already present? Default FALSE. output_dir Output directory save downloaded DEM . Defaults current working directory. filename Filename saved DEM. default, filename either 1) letterblock names, seperated underscores (e.g., "92b_92g.dem"), fewer 5 letterblocks downloaded; 2) simply "BC_DEM.dem", greater 5 letterblocks downloaded.

title: Download British Columbia Digital Elevation Model data — BC_DEM
text: RasterSpat object.

title: Download British Columbia Digital Elevation Model data — BC_DEM
code: if (FALSE) { BC_DEM("92b", save_output = F) # download Victoria area DEM, don't save it BC_DEM("103f", output_dir = "temp/bc_dem", filename = "haida_gwaii.dem") # download one tile of Haida Gwaii DEM and save output to "temp/bc_dem/haida_gwaii.dem" }

title: MAMU: Functions for BC Marbled Murrelet (MAMU) Forestry analyses — MAMU-package
text: Maintainer: Sarah Popov sarah.popov@mail.mcgill.ca (ORCID)

title: All catchments — all_catchments
text: spatial feature (sf) class object containing multipolygon versions MAMU catchments 2023-03-31.

title: All catchments — all_catchments
text: spatial feature (sf) object containing 130 features fid Feature ID polygon. Primary key differentiating unique polygon used match radar survey data catchments. region MAMU conservation region catchment falls within, originally defined FLNR polygons. region_2 MAMU conservation region catchment falls within, defined ECCC. code Short alphanumeric code abbreviating catchment name. catchment Name catchment. version Version number catchment. Useful keep track cases catchment multiple iterations re-drawn (e.g., see Artlish Toquart example). coastal_buff_500m Logical (T/F) - catchment 500m buffer coastline? area Polygon area m^2.

title: Virtual Raster Dataset — make_vrt
code: if (FALSE) { # Download some BC DEM tiles... tiles <- c("92h", "93c", "93l", "93m", "104a", "104b") sapply(tiles, BC_DEM,        save_output = TRUE,        overwrite = FALSE,        output_dir = "temp/DEM_tiles/") # Create VRT make_vrt(path = "temp/DEM_tiles/", filename = "temp/BC_DEM_VRT.vrt", overwrite = TRUE) }

what: Import and Clean ECCC-FLNR MAMU Radar Data — process_radar_data
title: Import and Clean ECCC-FLNR MAMU Radar Data — process_radar_data
text: function read Excel file provided path perform standardized series cleaning steps always need performed ECCC-FLNR MAMU radar survey data prior analyses.

title: Import and Clean ECCC-FLNR MAMU Radar Data — process_radar_data
Import and Clean ECCC-FLNR MAMU Radar Data — process_radar_data
text: path File path radar data Excel file. site_groupings (optional) Dataframe site name groups two columns: 1) original_name 2) new_name.

title: Import and Clean ECCC-FLNR MAMU Radar Data — process_radar_data
text: dataframe cleaned radar data.

title: Import and Clean ECCC-FLNR MAMU Radar Data — process_radar_data
text: function first performs housekeeping tasks: Make R-friendly column names Create survey_date column year, month, day columns Re-calculate day--year (doy) Fix minor typos, e.g. "Skwakwa" -> "Skwawka" filters data following criteria: Include "Complete" surveys Include pre-dawn surveys (.e., 2 8 ) Exclude August surveys Exclude Alaska border region surveys Finally, creates new_name column, groups sites slightly different names really single site. user can either rely default radar site name changes bundled package (see ?rs), can specify dataframe site_groupings param.

title: Import and Clean ECCC-FLNR MAMU Radar Data — process_radar_data
text: Site groupings must provided dataframe two columns: original_name new_name, original_name column contains site names found raw data new_name column contains name want site renamed . Run data(rs) example default name changes bundled package.

title: Import and Clean ECCC-FLNR MAMU Radar Data — process_radar_data
code: # Clean using function defaults process_radar_data("~/Documents/path/to/radar/data.xlsx") #> Error: `path` does not exist: ‘~/Documents/path/to/radar/data.xlsx’  # Provide your own site groupings sg <- data.frame(original_name = c("Fairfax 2", "Coleman Boat", "Nekite 1", "Nekite 2"),                  new_name = c("Fairfax", "Coleman", "Nekite", "Nekite")) process_radar_data("~/Documents/path/to/radar/data.xlsx",                    site_groupings = sg) #> Error: `path` does not exist: ‘~/Documents/path/to/radar/data.xlsx’

Buffers around radar survey sites — radar_buffers

title: Buffers around radar survey sites — radar_buffers
text: sf object

title: Buffers around radar survey sites — radar_buffers
code: surveys <- process_radar_data("~/Documents/path/to/radar/data.xlsx") #> Error: `path` does not exist: ‘~/Documents/path/to/radar/data.xlsx’ buffs <- radar_buffers(surveys) #> Error: 'st_centroid' is not an exported object from 'namespace:dplyr' plot(sf::st_geometry(buffs)) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'buffs' not found

what: Create a conical gradient of interpolated values around a point — radar_cone
title: Create a conical gradient of interpolated values around a point — radar_cone
text: Using given coordinate, function generate circle given radius around point fill circle gradient values conical pattern. default, interpolated values range zero one, values one point direction specified heading.

title: Create a conical gradient of interpolated values around a point — radar_cone
code: radar_cone(   pt,   radius,   heading,   theta = 0,   res = 500,   mask = TRUE,   invert = FALSE,   maxvalue = 1 )

title: Create a conical gradient of interpolated values around a point — radar_cone
text: pt single (X,Y) coordinate class sfc_POINT (created sf package), CRS projected coordinate system. radius Numeric. Distance meters point pt draw circle radius. heading Numeric. Heading, compass degrees, interpolate values . theta Numeric (0 360). Angle, degrees, indicating amount circle taken maxvalue. example, want create wedge 1/3 circle == 1, set theta = 120. Default 0. res Numeric. Resolution, meters, output raster. Default 500. mask Boolean (TRUE/FALSE). output masked circle shape (rather square)? Default TRUE. invert Boolean (TRUE/FALSE). values output cone inverted, values direction heading 0 rather 1? Default FALSE. maxvalue Numeric. Maximum value interpolated values cone. interpolated values run 0 maxvalue. Default 1.

title: Create a conical gradient of interpolated values around a point — radar_cone
text: SpatRaster object

title: Create a conical gradient of interpolated values around a point — radar_cone
text: using function spatial features, ensure data projected equal-area coordinate system. function assumes meters default unit. function originally developed intention generating 'cones probability' estimating dispersal birds flying across landscape. Radar stations based across British Columbia, Canada, collected data mean headings birds flying across radar station. headings indicate likely direction birds flying , headings opposite direction indicate areas birds flying away . Thus, gradient values 0 (flying away) 1 (flying towards) developed around given radar station using function.

title: Rasterize VRI polygons — rasterize_vri
text: rasterize_vri() quickly rasterize given VRI (multi)polygon using fasterize::fasterize() hood default resolution 10x10 m per pixel. default, function filters polygons occurring >900m elevation reported VRI 'Elevation' column.

title: Rasterize VRI polygons — rasterize_vri
text: path Path either .gdb directory, .shp file, .gpkg containing VRI polygons. layer path Geodatabase Geopackage, layer name VRI polygons. below_900m Logical (T/F). function rasterize polygons 900m? Default TRUE. FALSE, function ignore 'Elevation' column rasterize polygons. res Resolution meters resultant raster. Default 10 m^2.

title: Rasterize VRI polygons — rasterize_vri
code: path <- "~/Documents/path/to/VRI.gdb" layer <- "VRI_Algorithm_Jan11_2023" vri <- rasterize_vri(path = path, layer = layer) #> Error in rasterize_vri(path = path, layer = layer): could not find function "rasterize_vri"

title: Radar site groupings — rs
text: small data lookup containing radar survey sites renamed data cleaning process process_radar_data().

title: Radar site groupings — rs
text: dataframe 15 rows 2 variables: original_name Original site name appears 'Name$' column raw ECCC-FLNR MAMU radar data. new_name New, cleaned site name. cleaned name can used later analyses group radar sites need consolidated.

title: Return letterblock (tile) download URLs — tile_urls

title: Return letterblock (tile) download URLs — tile_urls
text: character vector download URLs associated given BC DEM letterblock.

what: Output path to the VRI database — vri_dir
title: Output path to the VRI database — vri_dir
text: Prints VRI database storage location, regardless OS. E.g., Mac: ~Library/Application Support/VRI Windows, either: C:\\Documents Settings\<User>\\Application Data\\Local Settings\<AppAuthor>\\VRI : C:\\Documents Settings\<User>\\Application Data\<AppAuthor>\\VRI
